definition: to recover lost territory
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to repeat/to double/to overlap/complex (not simple)/compound/composite/double/diplo-/duplicate/overlapping/to duplicate

earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Skeptics say Chinese bank stocks might not recover their lost ground.
sentences.chinese: 怀疑论者认为，中资银行股或许无法收复失地。

sentences.english: Major European indexes erased early morning losses.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲几大股指早盘收复失地。

sentences.english: After the term of the armistice expired in 1590, Russian troops moved in to take them back.
sentences.chinese: 在1590年停战期满后，露西亚军队挥师收复失地。
